trans-unit.source: Error During Authentication Detection
trans-unit.target: Error During Authentication Detection

trans-unit.source: The active directory connection wizard detected an incompatible authentication type
trans-unit.target: The active directory connection wizard detected an incompatible authentication type

trans-unit.source: Error During Authentication Detection
trans-unit.target: Error During Authentication Detection

trans-unit.source: While detecting previous authentication code, the wizard detected an incompatible authentication type.
trans-unit.target: While detecting previous authentication code, the wizard detected an incompatible authentication type.

trans-unit.source: What is being checked?
trans-unit.target: What is being checked?

trans-unit.source: **Note:** In order to correctly detect previous authentication code in a project, the project must be built.
trans-unit.target: **Note:** In order to correctly detect previous authentication code in a project, the project must be built.

trans-unit.source: If you encountered this error and you don't have previous authentication code in your project, rebuild and try again.
trans-unit.target: If you encountered this error and you don't have previous authentication code in your project, rebuild and try again.

trans-unit.source: Project Types
trans-unit.target: Project Types

trans-unit.source: The wizard checks which type of project you’re developing so it can inject the right authentication logic into the project.
trans-unit.target: The wizard checks which type of project you’re developing so it can inject the right authentication logic into the project.

trans-unit.source: If there is any controller that derives from `ApiController` in the project, it will be considered a WebAPI project.
trans-unit.target: If there is any controller that derives from `ApiController` in the project, it will be considered a WebAPI project.

trans-unit.source: If there are only controllers that derive from `MVC.Controller` in the project, it will be considered an MVC project.
trans-unit.target: If there are only controllers that derive from `MVC.Controller` in the project, it will be considered an MVC project.

trans-unit.source: Anything else is considered not supported by the wizard.
trans-unit.target: Anything else is considered not supported by the wizard.

trans-unit.source: WebForms projects are not currently supported.
trans-unit.target: WebForms projects are not currently supported.

trans-unit.source: Compatible Authentication Code
trans-unit.target: Compatible Authentication Code

trans-unit.source: The wizard also checks for authentication settings that have been previously configured with the wizard or are compatible with the wizard.
trans-unit.target: The wizard also checks for authentication settings that have been previously configured with the wizard or are compatible with the wizard.

trans-unit.source: If all of the settings are present, it is considered a re-entrant case and the wizard will open and display the settings.
trans-unit.target: If all of the settings are present, it is considered a re-entrant case and the wizard will open and display the settings.

trans-unit.source: If only some of the settings are present, it is considered an error case.
trans-unit.target: If only some of the settings are present, it is considered an error case.

trans-unit.source: In an MVC project, the wizard checks for any of the following settings, which result from previous use of the wizard:
trans-unit.target: In an MVC project, the wizard checks for any of the following settings, which result from previous use of the wizard:

trans-unit.source: In addition, the wizard checks for any of the following settings in a Web API project, which result from previous use of the wizard:
trans-unit.target: In addition, the wizard checks for any of the following settings in a Web API project, which result from previous use of the wizard:

trans-unit.source: Incompatible Authentication Code
trans-unit.target: Incompatible Authentication Code

trans-unit.source: Finally, the wizard attempts to detect versions of authentication code that have been configured with previous versions of Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Finally, the wizard attempts to detect versions of authentication code that have been configured with previous versions of Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: If you received this error, it means your project contains an incompatible authentication type.
trans-unit.target: If you received this error, it means your project contains an incompatible authentication type.

trans-unit.source: The wizard detects the following types of authentication from previous versions of Visual Studio:
trans-unit.target: The wizard detects the following types of authentication from previous versions of Visual Studio:

trans-unit.source: Windows Authentication
trans-unit.target: Windows Authentication

trans-unit.source: Individual User Accounts
trans-unit.target: Individual User Accounts

trans-unit.source: Organizational Accounts
trans-unit.target: Organizational Accounts

trans-unit.source: To detect Windows Authentication in an MVC project, the wizard looks for the `authentication` element from your **web.config** file.
trans-unit.target: To detect Windows Authentication in an MVC project, the wizard looks for the `authentication` element from your **web.config** file.

trans-unit.source: To detect Windows Authentication in a Web API project, the wizard looks for the `IISExpressWindowsAuthentication` element from your project's **.csproj** file:
trans-unit.target: To detect Windows Authentication in a Web API project, the wizard looks for the `IISExpressWindowsAuthentication` element from your project's **.csproj** file:

trans-unit.source: To detect Individual User Accounts authentication, the wizard looks for the package element from your **Packages.config** file.
trans-unit.target: To detect Individual User Accounts authentication, the wizard looks for the package element from your **Packages.config** file.

trans-unit.source: To detect an old form of Organizational Account authentication, the wizard looks for the following element from **web.config**:
trans-unit.target: To detect an old form of Organizational Account authentication, the wizard looks for the following element from **web.config**:

trans-unit.source: To change the authentication type, remove the incompatible authentication type and run the wizard again.
trans-unit.target: To change the authentication type, remove the incompatible authentication type and run the wizard again.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Authentication Scenarios for Azure AD](active-directory-authentication-scenarios.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Authentication Scenarios for Azure AD](active-directory-authentication-scenarios.md).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
